summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from May 2021 between Sigrid McCawley, a partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding scheduling for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It discusses witness availability and confirms the trial schedule, with jury selection set for November 15, 2021, and the trial beginning on November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office about trial scheduling and witness availability for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, for which the trial is being scheduled.

connections.description: McCawley is communicating with prosecutors about scheduling, indicating she represents a witness or party with interests in the Maxwell case, though her direct client is not explicitly stated here.

events.title: Jury selection scheduled
events.description: Jury selection for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to occur during the week of November 15, 2021.

events.title: Trial begins
events.description: The trial for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021.

keyFacts: The trial date for Ghislaine Maxwell was set, with jury selection the week of November 15, 2021, and the trial beginning November 29, 2021.
Sigrid McCawley, a partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, was coordinating with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding witness availability for the trial.
A key witness (name redacted) preferred an early September trial date due to a pending adoption, with a baby due in early November.
The correspondence shows procedural coordination between defense/plaintiff counsel and prosecutors in the lead-up to Maxwell's trial.
The document is part of the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
